instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 220ma
threads.message: Board was drawing 14ma initially <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> was partially short, <CAPACITOR>C7600</CAPACITOR> was reading 2v, so removed <CAPACITOR>C7600</CAPACITOR> and <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> 5v  was present. After swapping out both components unit rises to 200ma . L7320 and L7310 both read .5 ohm . Would it be safe enough to say the cpu is dead on this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 220ma
threads.message:
0.5 ohm means shorted CPU...

Easy to confirm, injecting voltage (no more than 2V), with heatsink removed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 220ma
threads.message: I tried that but its actually not heating

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A 220ma
threads.message:
Do you have a good PSU?
5A PSU doesn't help now.
At least try starting with 1V and maintain current under PSU limit.

Get 20A PSU for injecting voltage!!!
